page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT IN SALISBURY
page.content: The pupils of Avon Middle School interviewed 27 people. Each had a different status, they were students or employees or managers. A warden at an old peoples' home starts work at 6.45 a.m. A hairdresser works 9 to 5, 5 days a week. At Salisbury Technical College there are over 4000 students. Examples of their working life are :The two year bakery course starts at 9.00a.m. and finish at 4.30p.m. The clerks of work course starts at 9.00 a.m. and finishes at 5.00p.m. A manager of Salisbury swimming pool goes to work at 8.00a.m. He finishes at 5,9 or 10p.m. A staff manager of Woolworths works from 10 past 7 a.m. to 5.30p.m. A bar manager is busiest at weekends, his busiest time is 8.30 - 11 p.m.
